âœ¨ ArchivedV | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Archiving and saving unarchived singing streams from YouTube, especially Vtubers, to prevent content loss due to copyright or unarchiving practices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automatic checking of subscribed channels for new live streams â€¢ Download matching videos based on specified keywords â€¢ Web interface for managing channels and keywords â€¢ Fail-safe auto-merger using ffmpeg for incomplete stream files
ðŸ“– Summary: ArchivedV is a JavaScript-based service designed to automatically download and save singing streams from YouTube, particularly those from Vtubers that might be unarchived due to copyright issues. It features keyword filtering, a web interface for management, and robust error handling for stream interruptions.

âœ¨ dockmon | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring and managing Docker containers across multiple hosts with features like auto-restart and alerts.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-Host Monitoring â€¢ Agent-Based Remote Monitoring â€¢ Real-Time Dashboard â€¢ Real-Time Statistics â€¢ Real-Time Container Logs
ðŸ“– Summary: DockMon is a comprehensive platform for monitoring and managing Docker containers. It offers real-time insights, intelligent auto-restart capabilities, multi-channel alerting, and detailed event logging for single or multiple Docker hosts.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ HunyuanVideo-Avatar | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating realistic and emotionally expressive multi-character animated videos from audio input, with strong character consistency.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ High-fidelity audio-driven human animation â€¢ Character image injection for consistency â€¢ Audio Emotion Module (AEM) for fine-grained emotion control â€¢ Multi-character dialogue animation â€¢ Single GPU inference with low VRAM (10GB)
ðŸ“– Summary: HunyuanVideo-Avatar is a multimodal diffusion transformer model designed for generating high-fidelity, audio-driven human animations. It excels at creating dynamic videos with consistent characters, precise emotion alignment, and supports multi-character dialogue animation.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ assayo | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide detailed, visualized analysis of Git commit history for project management and team performance evaluation.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Analysis of work pace and overtime hours â€¢ Identification of responsibility zones, features, and bugs â€¢ Assessment of colleagues' working styles â€¢ Tracking employee turnover and team composition â€¢ Mapping developer locations
ðŸ“– Summary: Assayo is a tool that generates an HTML report analyzing Git commit statistics. It provides insights into work pace, overtime, team dynamics, developer locations, release schedules, and project costs, offering a comprehensive overview of project development and team performance.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ bentopdf | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a secure, private, and self-hostable solution for client-side PDF manipulation and editing within a web browser.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Privacy-first, client-side processing â€¢ Self-hostable deployment options â€¢ PDF manipulation (merge, split, organize pages) â€¢ PDF editing capabilities â€¢ No server-side processing required
ðŸ“– Summary: BentoPDF is a self-hostable, client-side JavaScript PDF toolkit designed for privacy. It allows users to manipulate, edit, merge, and process PDF files directly in the browser without requiring any server-side interaction, ensuring data security and user privacy.
